meanings.definition: To pay back money that was spent
meanings.sent1: I will reimburse you for the lunch you bought yesterday.
meanings.sent2: She reimbursed me for the concert tickets I purchased.
meanings.sent3: The kind neighbor offered to reimburse me for the gas I used to drive to the store.
meanings.sent4: His honesty will reimburse him with trust from others.
meanings.sent5: The company promised to reimburse all travel expenses for the business trip.

meanings.sent1: The insurance company will reimburse you for the damage to your car.
meanings.sent2: The company reimbursed the employee for the work-related costs.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected bonus will reimburse the extra money spent on the vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could never reimburse the kindness he showed her.
meanings.sent5: The scholarship will reimburse the student for the tuition fees.
